intro: Select fields components are used for collecting user provided information from a list of options.

custom.heading: Custom text and value
custom.intro: You can specify the specific properties within your items array correspond to the text and value fields. By default, this is text and value. In this example we also use the return-object prop which will return the entire object of the selected item on selection.

dense.heading: Dense
dense.intro: You can use dense prop to reduce the field height and lower max height of list items.

disabled.heading: Disabled
disabled.intro: Applying the disabled prop to a v-select will prevent a user from interacting with the component.

icons.heading: Icons
icons.intro: Use a custom prepended or appended icon.

light.heading: Light
light.intro: A standard single select has a multitude of configuration options.

menu.heading: Menu props
menu.intro: Custom props can be passed directly to v-menu using menuProps prop. In this example menu is force directed to top and shifted to top.

multiple.heading: Multiple
multiple.intro: A multi-select can utilize v-chip as the display for selected items.

readonly.heading: Readonly
readonly.intro: You cannot use read-only v-select, but it looks default.

appendprepend.heading: Append and prepend item
appendprepend.intro: The v-select components can be optionally expanded with prepended and appended items. This is perfect for customized select-all functionality.

selection.heading: Selection
selection.intro: The selection slot can be used to customize the way selected values are shown in the input. This is great when you want something like foo (+20 others) or donâ€™t want the selection to occupy multiple lines.
